content: it s recommended that mc is the dominating color so you d be switching the yarn orders in the middle knit row 1 35 of chart 1 on row 36 knit until you reach the stitches marking the thumb position the thumb is positioned differently in chart 1 for left and right hand mitten using a piece of scrap yarn knit 9 stitches slide the scrap yarn stitches back onto the left needle then work again with working yarns finish round as normal knit row 37 -75 of chart 1 divide stitches evenly on two needles and bobble with kitchener s stitch using cc thumb carefully pick up the stitches below and above the scrap yarn marking the thumb position and remove the scrap yarn you should end up with 9 stitches at the bottom edge of the hole and 9 stitches at the top edge the stitches at the bottom edge will become the front of the thumb and the stitches on the upper edge will become the back of the thumb starting on the front stitches knit stitches 11-19 of chart 2 setup row use cc as dominating yarn for all of chart 2 pick up one stitch on the hole edge between the front and back stitches with cc at the left side of the front stitches marked as stitch #20 in chart 2 for the back stitches knit stitches 1-9 of the first row of chart 2 then pick up one stitch on the edge hole stitch #10 and for the front stitches continue as per chart 2 until the end of the row you now have 20 stitches on the needles knit row 2 18 of chart 2 pull both yarns through the remaining 12 stitches finishing weave in all the ends block the mittens well to even out the fabric copyright notice this
